definitions.text: the sound made by something moving rapidly or by steam coming out of a small aperture
the act of signalling (e.g., summoning) by whistling or blowing a whistle
examples: the whistle signalled the end of the game

definitions.text: a small wind instrument that produces a whistling sound by blowing into it
acoustic device that forces air or steam against an edge or into a cavity and so produces a loud shrill sound

examples: He lay there, snoring and whistling

definitions.text: move with, or as with, a whistling sound
move, send, or bring as if by whistling
examples: Her optimism whistled away these worries

definitions.text: make a whining, ringing, or whistling sound
examples: the bullet sang past his ear
